Class Vector2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.Point2D
      • java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double
        • Vector2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Vector2D
extends java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double
    A class representing a position vector. The x variable represents the change in x that this vector would effect. The y variable represents the change in y that this vector would effect.
    Author:
    Jiayin Huang, Tony Cui, Sally Hui
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.geom.Point2D

        java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double, java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double

        x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector2D()
      Creates a new velocity vector with x and y components of (0,0).
      Vector2D(double dx, double dy)
      Creates a new velocity vector with the specified x component and y component.
      Vector2D(Vector2D v)
      Creates a new Vector identical to the specified vector.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Vector2D v)
      Adds the specified vector to this vector.
      double getAngle()
      Determines the direction of this vector.
      double getMagnitude()
      Uses the Pythagorean theorem on the x and y components to determine the length of this vector.
      static Vector2D getVectorFromDirection(double magnitude, double theta)
      Returns a new Vector2D defined by the indicated magnitude and angle.
      static Vector2D getVectorFromDirection(double magnitude, double x, double y)
      Returns a new Vector2D defined by the indicated magnitude, and x and y components.
      static Vector2D getVectorFromPosition(double dx, double dy)
      Returns a new Vector2D defined by the indicated x component and y component.
      void rotate(double deltaTheta)
      Rotates this vector about the origin by the specified angle.
      void scale(double scalar)
      Multiplies this vector by the specified scalar.
      void setMagnitude(double magnitude)
      Sets the length of this vector while maintaining its current direction.

        public Vector2D()
        Creates a new velocity vector with x and y components of (0,0).

        dy - y component of vector

    • Method Detail

      • getVectorFromDirection

        public static Vector2D getVectorFromDirection(double magnitude,
                              double x,
                              double y)
        Returns a new Vector2D defined by the indicated magnitude, and x and y components. The x and y components are just used a ratio; the direction of the vector. Thus, x and y components of 2,3 and 4,6 would be equivalent.
        Parameters:
        magnitude - the length of the vector
        x - the x component of the vector
        y - the y component of the vector
        Returns:
        the new Vector2D

      • getVectorFromDirection

        public static Vector2D getVectorFromDirection(double magnitude,
                              double theta)
        Returns a new Vector2D defined by the indicated magnitude and angle.
        Parameters:
        magnitude - the length of the vector
        theta - the direction of the vector, in radians
        Returns:
        the new Vector2D

      • getVectorFromPosition

        public static Vector2D getVectorFromPosition(double dx,
                             double dy)
        Returns a new Vector2D defined by the indicated x component and y component.
        Parameters:
        dx - the x component
        dy - the y component
        Returns:
        the new Vector2D

      • add

        public void add(Vector2D v)
        Adds the specified vector to this vector.
        Parameters:
        v - the vector to be added

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Determines the direction of this vector.
        Returns:
        the direction as an angle, in radians

      • getMagnitude

        public double getMagnitude()
        Uses the Pythagorean theorem on the x and y components to determine the length of this vector.
        Returns:
        the length of this vector

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double deltaTheta)
        Rotates this vector about the origin by the specified angle.
        Parameters:
        deltaTheta - the angle to rotate, in radians

      • scale

        public void scale(double scalar)
        Multiplies this vector by the specified scalar. If the scalar > 1, the vector will get longer. If the scalar < 1, the vector will get shorter.
        Parameters:
        scalar - the scalar by which the x and y values will be multiplied

      • setMagnitude

        public void setMagnitude(double magnitude)
        Sets the length of this vector while maintaining its current direction.
        Parameters:
        magnitude - the new vector length
